Title: Business Model Identification and Taxonomy
Main Question: What business models have been identified in the literature for software product monetization, and how are they defined, classified, and differentiated from each other?

Title: Application Context and Market Segmentation
Main Question: In which application contexts (vertical segments, customer types, geographies, and company sizes) have different software business models been implemented, and what segmentation patterns emerge from this distribution?

Title: Technical and Architectural Characteristics
Main Question: What are the technical, architectural, and delivery characteristics that distinguish different software business models, and how do these characteristics influence monetization?

Title: Monetization and Pricing Strategies
Main Question: What are the monetization and pricing strategies used in different software business models, and how do these strategies relate to the characteristics of the model and the market?

Title: Ecosystem Dynamics and Go-to-Market
Main Question: What are the ecosystem dynamics (roles, relationships, network effects) and go-to-market strategies (acquisition channels, marketplaces) associated with different software business models?

Title: Motivations, Success Factors, and Adoption Conditions
Main Question: What are the motivations for adoption, the factors that contribute to success, and the necessary conditions (prerequisites) for successful implementation of different software business models?

Title: Implementation Challenges and Mitigation
Main Question: What are the main challenges faced in implementing different software business models, and what effective practices have been used to mitigate these challenges?

Title: Temporal Evolution and Future Trends
Main Question: What is the temporal evolution and maturity of the different software business models identified in the literature, and what are the future trends and projected evolution directions?

Title: Business Model Canvas Elements
Main Question: What are the distinctive characteristics and constituent elements (Business Model Canvas) of each identified software business model, and how do these elements relate to each other to create value?

Title: Empirical Evidence and Methodologies
Main Question: What types of empirical evidence and research methodologies have been used to study software business models, and what are the patterns of available evidence for each model?
